title: Teaching
text:
Below is a list of all the courses for which I have served as a teaching assistant or instructor during my time at the University of Washington.


Instructor

CS&SS 508 Introduction to R for Social Scientists (Graduate Course) - Autumn 2023
Sociology 316 Sociological Theory - Summer 2023
Sociology 221 Statistical Concepts and Methods for the Social Sciences - Summer 2021
Sociology 404 Sociology in Practice: Community/Civic Internship Program - Spring 2018
Sociology 404 Sociology in Practice: Community/Civic Internship Program - Winter 2018
Sociology 321 Case-Based Social Statistics I (Honors Course) - Autumn 2017



Teaching Assistant

Sociology 506 Methodology: Quantitative Techniques in Sociology (Graduate Course) - Spring 2021
Sociology 505 Applied Social Statistics (Graduate Course) - Winter 2021
Sociology 504 Applied Social Statistics (Graduate Course) - Autumn 2020
Statistics 220 Basic Statistics - Summer 2015
Sociology 270 Social Problems - Spring 2015
Sociology 201 Surviving in South Africa: Contemporary Health and Population Issues - Winter 2015
Sociology 300 Foundations of Social Inquiry - Fall 2014

title: About
text: I’m currently a Ph.D candidate in the Sociology department at the University of Washington. My research interests broadly focus on health disparities, the social construction of disease, and the relationship between physical and mental health outcomes. My dissertation seeks to better understand the mental and physical health effects of a weight-centric health paradigm through the mechanism of dieting for weight-loss and/or weight-maintenance.

title: Victoria Sass
text:
My research interests broadly focus on health disparities, the social construction of disease, and the relationship between physical and mental health outcomes. My dissertation seeks to better understand the long-term mental and physical health effects of a weight-centric health paradigm through the mechanism of dieting for weight-loss and/or weight-maintenance.
